briefdescription.para: Initialize a new roadRunner instance and return a handle to it.

simplesect.para: Returns a RoadRunner instance, returns null if it fails

briefdescription.para: Initialize a new roadRunner instance and return a handle to it.

parameterdescription.para: may be NULL, if NULL, uses default compiler. If LLVM build is enabled, setting compiler to "llvm" enables llvm based model generation.

simplesect.para: Returns a RoadRunner instance, returns null if it fails

briefdescription.para: Free the roadRunner instance.
Returns the folder in which the RoadRunner wrappers is installed.

simplesect.para: Pointer to string holding the install folder

briefdescription.para: Set the internal string containing the folder in where the RoadRunner C wrappers is installed.

parameterdescription.para: Pointer to string holding the install folder

simplesect.para: Boolean indicating success

briefdescription.para: Retrieve the current version number of the C wrappers library.

simplesect.para: Returns null if it fails, otherwise it returns the version number of the C wrappers library

briefdescription.para: Retrieve the current version number of the C++ wrappers (Core RoadRunner wrappers) library.

simplesect.para: Returns null if it fails, otherwise it returns the version number of the C++ wrappers library

detaileddescription.para:
the roadrunner version number in the form or 102030 if the number is 1.2.3
returns the individual version numbers as XXYYZZ where XX is the major version, YY the minor and ZZ the revision, eg 10000, or 10100, 20000 etc
returns roadrunner as a string, i.e. "1.0.0"
returns something like "1.0.0; compiled with clang "3.3 (tags/RELEASE_33/final)" on date Dec 8 2013, 17:24:57'

briefdescription.para: Retrieve extended wrappers info.

simplesect.para: Returns null if it fails, otherwise it returns a string with the info

briefdescription.para: Retrieve the current build date of the library.

simplesect.para: Returns null if it fails, otherwise it returns the build date

briefdescription.para: Retrieve the current build time (HH:MM:SS) of the library.

simplesect.para: Returns null if it fails, otherwise it returns the build time

briefdescription.para: Retrieve the current build date + time of the library.

simplesect.para: Returns null if it fails, otherwise it returns the build date + time

briefdescription.para: Retrieve the current copyright notice for the library.

simplesect.para: Returns null if it fails, otherwise it returns the copyright string

briefdescription.para: Retrieve info about current state of roadrunner, e.g. loaded model, conservationAnalysis etc.

simplesect.para: Returns null if it fails, otherwise it returns a string with the info

briefdescription.para: Retrieve the current version number of the libSBML library.

simplesect.para: Returns null if it fails, otherwise it returns the version number of the library

briefdescription.para: Set the path to the temporary folder where the C code will be stored.

detaileddescription.para:
When RoadRunner is run in C generation mode its uses a temporary folder to store the generated C source code. This method can be used to set the temporary folder path if necessary.
handle
Handle to a RoadRunner instance
folder
Pointer to string holding folder path
Returns true if successful

briefdescription.para: Retrieve the current temporary folder path.

detaileddescription.para:
When RoadRunner is run in C generation mode its uses a temporary folder to store the generate C source code. This method can be used to get the current value for the temporary folder path.
handle
Handle to a RoadRunner instance
Returns null if it fails, otherwise it returns the path

briefdescription.para: Retrieve the current working directory path.

simplesect.para: Returns null if it fails, otherwise it returns the path

briefdescription.para: Retrieve the directory path of the shared rrCApi library.

simplesect.para: Returns null if it fails, otherwise it returns the path

briefdescription.para: Set the path and filename to the compiler to be used by roadrunner.

parameterdescription.para: Pointer to string holding the fileName and path to a compiler

simplesect.para: Returns true if successful

briefdescription.para: Get the name of the compiler currently being used by roadrunner.
Set the path to a folder containing the compiler to be used.

parameterdescription.para: Pointer to string holding the path to a compiler

simplesect.para: Returns true if successful

briefdescription.para: Get the path to a folder containing the compiler being used.

simplesect.para: Returns the path if successful, NULL otherwise

briefdescription.para: Set the path to a folder containing support code for model generation.

parameterdescription.para: Pointer to string holding the path to the support code folder

simplesect.para: Returns true if successful

briefdescription.para: Get the path to a folder containing support code.

simplesect.para: Returns the path if successful, NULL otherwise

briefdescription.para: Set the runtime generation option [Not yet implemented].

detaileddescription.para: RoadRunner can either execute a model by generating, compiling and linking self-generated C code or it can employ an internal interpreter to evaluate the model equations. The later method is useful when the OS forbids the compiling of externally generated code.

parameterdescription.para: is set to 0 RoadRunner generates C Code, if set to 1 RoadRunner uses its internal math interpreter.

simplesect.para: Returns false if it fails,

briefdescription.para: Check if there is an error string to retrieve.

simplesect.para: Returns true if there is an error waiting to be retrieved

briefdescription.para: Retrieve the current error string.

simplesect.para: Return null if fails, otherwise returns a pointer to the error string

briefdescription.para: Enable or disable conservation analysis.

parameterdescription.para: Set true to switch on conservation analysis

simplesect.para: Returns true if successful

briefdescription.para: Get the value of the moiety conservation setting.

parameterdescription.para: A place to store the value

simplesect.para: Returns true if successful

briefdescription.para: Load a model from an SBML string.

simplesect.para: Returns true if successful

briefdescription.para: Load a model from an SBML string.

parameterdescription.para: boolean. True means the model is recompiled. False causes roadrunner to use an already compiled model

simplesect.para: Returns true if successful

briefdescription.para: Save a road runner instance's state to a platform-specific binary file.

parameterdescription.para: Handle to the RoadRunner instance to be saved
path to the file to be saved to

simplesect.para: Returns true if successful

briefdescription.para: Reload a road runner instance's state saved by saveState.

parameterdescription.para: Handle to the RoadRunner instance to be loaded into
path to the file to be loaded from

simplesect.para: Returns true if successful

briefdescription.para: Load a model from a SBML file.

parameterdescription.para: file name (or full path) to file that holds the SBML model

simplesect.para: Returns true if successful

briefdescription.para: Load a model from a SBML file, force recompilation.

parameterdescription.para: file name (or full path) to file that holds the SBML model
Boolean that forces recompilation if true. If false, no compilation occur if model dll exists

simplesect.para: Returns true if successful

briefdescription.para: Unload current model.

simplesect.para: Returns true if successful

briefdescription.para: check if a model is loaded

simplesect.para: Returns true/false indicating whether a model is loaded or not

briefdescription.para: Load simulation settings from a file.

parameterdescription.para: file name (or full path) to file that holds simulation settings

simplesect.para: Returns true if successful

briefdescription.para: Retrieve the current state of the model in the form of an SBML string.

simplesect.para: Returns null if the call fails, otherwise returns a pointer to the SBML string

briefdescription.para: Retrieve the SBML model that was last loaded into roadRunner.

simplesect.para: Returns null if the call fails, otherwise returns a pointer to the SBML string

memberdef.argsstring: (RRHandle handle, const char *sid, const char *compartment, double initialAmount, bool hasOnlySubstanceUnits, bool boundaryCondition)
memberdef.name: addSpeciesAmount

briefdescription.para: Add a species to the current model.

parameterdescription.para: ID of the species to be added
Compartment of the species to be added
Initial amount of the species to be added
Boolean value indicating whether the species is always considered to be in amounts when used in other formulas.
Boolean value indicating whether the species is a boundary species.

simplesect.para: Returns false if the call fails, otherwise returns a true

Boolean value indicating whether the species is a boundary species.

simplesect.para: Returns false if the call fails, otherwise returns a true

memberdef.name: addInitialAssignment

briefdescription.para: Add an initial assignment to an exsiting symbol of the current model.

parameterdescription.para: : the math formula of the initial assignment

: a boolean value to indicate if the model is regenerated after this function call default value is true to regenerate model after each call of editing function to save time for editing for multiple times, one could set this flag to true only in the last call of editing

briefdescription.para: Add an assignment rule to the current model.

parameterdescription.para: ID of variable that rules assigns formula to
the math formula of assignment rule to be added

briefdescription.para: After a model has been edited, it needs to be compiled. Call regenerate to recompile a model so that it is ready for use.

simplesect.para: Returns false if the call fails, otherwise returns a true

briefdescription.para: Validate the current SBML file.

simplesect.para: Returns false if the current SBML file is not valid, otherwise returns a true

briefdescription.para: Promote any local parameters to global status.

detaileddescription.para: This routine will convert any local reaction parameters and promote them to global status. The promoted parameters are prefixed with the name of the reaction to make them unique.

parameterdescription.para: points to the SBML model to promote

simplesect.para: Returns null if it fails otherwise it returns the promoted SBML model as a string

briefdescription.para: Set the simulator's capabilities.

parameterdescription.para: An XML string that specifies the simulators capabilities

simplesect.para: Returns true if successful

briefdescription.para: Get the simulator's capabilities.

simplesect.para: Returns null if it fails, otherwise it returns the simulator's capabilities in the form of an XML string

briefdescription.para: Get the number of registered integrators.

simplesect.para: Returns an integer that corresponds to the number of currently registered integrators.

briefdescription.para: Get the name of a registered integrator (e.g. cvode etc.)

parameterdescription.para: The index of the registered integrator

simplesect.para: Callee owns memory

briefdescription.para: Get the hint of a registered integrator (e.g. cvode etc.)

parameterdescription.para: The index of the registered integrator

simplesect.para: Callee owns memory

briefdescription.para: Get the description of a registered integrator (e.g. cvode etc.)

parameterdescription.para: The index of the registered integrator

simplesect.para: Callee owns memory

briefdescription.para: Get the number of instantiated integrators. To instantiate an integrator, use setCurrentIntegrator.

simplesect.para: Returns an integer that corresponds to the number of currently registered integrators.

briefdescription.para: Specify the current integrator to be used for simulation. This method instantiates a new integrator of the given type (e.g. cvode, gillespie) if one does not currently exist. Otherwise, the existing integrator of this type is used.

parameterdescription.para: Name of the integrator to be used.

simplesect.para: Returns True if successful.

briefdescription.para: Obtain a description of the current integrator.

simplesect.para: Returns a description of the current integrator.

briefdescription.para: Obtain a description of the current integrator.

simplesect.para: Returns a description of the current integrator.

briefdescription.para: Obtain a short hint for the current integrator.

simplesect.para: Returns a short hint of the current integrator.

briefdescription.para: Get the number of adjustable settings for the current integrator.

simplesect.para: Returns an integer that corresponds to the number of adjustable integrator settings.

briefdescription.para: Get the name of a parameter of the current integrator.

parameterdescription.para: The index of the parameter (0 <= n < getNumberOfCurrentIntegratorParameters)

briefdescription.para: Get the description of a parameter of the current integrator.

parameterdescription.para: The index of the parameter (0 <= n < getNumberOfCurrentIntegratorParameters)

briefdescription.para: Get the display name of a parameter of the current integrator.

parameterdescription.para: The index of the parameter (0 <= n < getNumberOfCurrentIntegratorParameters)

briefdescription.para: Get the hint of a parameter of the current integrator.

parameterdescription.para: The index of the parameter (0 <= n < getNumberOfCurrentIntegratorParameters)

briefdescription.para: Get the type of a parameter of the current integrator.

parameterdescription.para: The index of the parameter (0 <= n < getNumberOfCurrentIntegratorParameters)

briefdescription.para: Reset the integrator parameters to their default values.

simplesect.para: Returns True if successful.

briefdescription.para: Get the names of adjustable settings for the current integrator.

simplesect.para: Returns a list that contains the names of adjustable integrator settings.

briefdescription.para: Get the description for a specific integrator setting.

simplesect.para: Returns a description for the integrator setting.

briefdescription.para: Get the hint for a specific integrator setting.

simplesect.para: Returns a hint for the integrator setting.

briefdescription.para: Get the return type for a specific integrator setting.

simplesect.para: Returns a integer that indicates the return type for the integrator setting. 0-STRING, 1-BOOL, 2-INT32, 3-UINT32, 4-INT64, 5-UINT64, 6-FLOAT, 7-DOUBLE, 8-CHAR, 9-UCHAR, 10-EMPTY

briefdescription.para: Get the integer value for a specific integrator setting.

simplesect.para: Returns an integer value for the integrator setting.

briefdescription.para: Set the integer value for a specific integrator setting.

parameterdescription.para: The integer value for the integrator setting.

simplesect.para: Returns True if successful.

briefdescription.para: Get the unsigned integer value for a specific integrator setting.

simplesect.para: Returns an integer value for the integrator setting.

memberdef.argsstring: (RRHandle handle, const char *parameterName, unsigned int value)
memberdef.name: setCurrentIntegratorParameterUInt

briefdescription.para: Set the unsigned integer value for a specific integrator setting.

parameterdescription.para: The integer value for the integrator setting.

simplesect.para: Returns True if successful.

briefdescription.para: Get the double value for a specific integrator setting.

briefdescription.para: Specify the current steady state solver to be used for simulation. This method instantiates a new steady state solver of the given type (e.g. cvode, gillespie) if one does not currently exist. Otherwise, the existing steady state solver of this type is used.

parameterdescription.para: Name of the steady state solver to be used.

simplesect.para: Returns True if successful.

simplesect.para: Returns a description of the current steady state solver.

briefdescription.para: Obtain a short hint for the current steady state solver.

parameterdescription.para: The index of the parameter (0 <= n < getNumberOfCurrentSteadyStateSolverParameters)

parameterdescription.para: The index of the parameter (0 <= n < getNumberOfCurrentSteadyStateSolverParameters)

parameterdescription.para: The index of the parameter (0 <= n < getNumberOfCurrentSteadyStateSolverParameters)

briefdescription.para: Reset the steady state solver parameters to their default values.

simplesect.para: Returns True if successful.

briefdescription.para: Set the time start for a time course simulation.

simplesect.para: Returns True if successful

briefdescription.para: Set the time end for a time course simulation.

simplesect.para: Returns true if successful

briefdescription.para: Set the number of points to generate in a time course simulation.

parameterdescription.para: Number of points to generate in the time course simulation

simplesect.para: Returns true if successful

briefdescription.para: Set the times vector to output in a time course simulation.

parameterdescription.para: vector of doubles to use as time output points.

simplesect.para: Returns true if successful

briefdescription.para: Set the selection list for output from simulate(void) or simulateEx(void)

detaileddescription.para: Use getAvailableTimeCourseSymbols(void) to retrieve the list of all possible symbols.

parameterdescription.para: A string of Ids separated by spaces or comma characters

simplesect.para: Returns true if successful

briefdescription.para: Get the current selection list for simulate(void) or simulateEx(void)

simplesect.para: A list of symbol Ids indicating the current selection list

briefdescription.para: Carry out a time-course simulation. setTimeStart, setTimeEnd, setNumPoints, etc are used to set the simulation characteristics.

simplesect.para: Returns an array (RRCDataPtr) of columns containing the results of the simulation including string labels for the individual columns. The client is responsible for freeing the resulting RRCDataPtr structure.

briefdescription.para: Carry out a time-course simulation. setTimeStart, setTimeEnd, setNumPoints, etc are used to set the simulation characteristics.

simplesect.para: Returns an array (RRCDataPtr) of columns containing the results of the simulation including string labels for the individual columns. The client is responsible for freeing the resulting RRCDataPtr structure.

briefdescription.para: Retrieve the result of the last simulation.

simplesect.para: Returns an array (RRCDataPtr) of columns containing the results of the simulation including string labels for the individual columns. The client is responsible for freeing the resulting RRCDataPtr structure.

briefdescription.para: Retrieve the result of the last simulation as a DoubleMatrix.

simplesect.para: Returns a pointer (RRHandle) containing the results of the simulation. The pointer is not owned by the caller.

memberdef.argsstring: (RRHandle handle, const double timeStart, const double timeEnd, const int numberOfPoints)
memberdef.name: simulateEx

briefdescription.para: Carry out a time-course simulation based on the given arguments, time start, time end and number of points.

simplesect.para: Returns an array (RRCDataPtr) of columns containing the results of the simulation including string labels for the individual columns. The client is responsible for freeing the resulting RRCDataPtr structure.

memberdef.argsstring: (RRHandle handle, const double timeStart, const double timeEnd, const int numberOfPoints)
memberdef.name: simulateExNoReturn

briefdescription.para: Carry out a time-course simulation based on the given arguments, time start, time end and number of points, but do not return results.

simplesect.para: Returns an array (RRCDataPtr) of columns containing the results of the simulation including string labels for the individual columns. The client is responsible for freeing the resulting RRCDataPtr structure.

briefdescription.para: Carry out a time-course simulation based on the given arguments, time start, time end and number of points.

simplesect.para: Returns an array (RRCDataPtr) of columns containing the results of the simulation including string labels for the individual columns. The client is responsible for freeing the resulting RRCDataPtr structure.

memberdef.argsstring: (RRHandle handle, const double currentTime, const double stepSize, double *value)
memberdef.name: oneStep

briefdescription.para: Carry out a one step integration of the model.

parameterdescription.para: The current time in the simulation
The step size to use in the integration

simplesect.para: Returns true if successful

briefdescription.para: Get the value of the current time start.

parameterdescription.para: The current value for the time start

simplesect.para: Returns true if successful

briefdescription.para: Get the value of the current time end.

parameterdescription.para: The current value for the time end

simplesect.para: Returns true if successful

briefdescription.para: Get the value of the current number of points.

parameterdescription.para: The current value for the number of points

simplesect.para: Returns true if successful

briefdescription.para: Compute the steady state of the current model.

parameterdescription.para: This value is set during the call and indicates how close the solution is to the steady state. The smaller the value the better. Values less than 1E-6 usually indicate a steady state has been found. If necessary call the method a second time to improve the solution.

simplesect.para: Returns true if successful

briefdescription.para: A convenient method for returning a vector of the steady state species concentrations.

simplesect.para: Returns the vector of steady state values or null if an error occurred. The order of species in the vector is indicated by the order of species Ids in a call to getFloatingSpeciesIds(void)

briefdescription.para: Set the selection list of the steady state analysis.

detaileddescription.para: Use getAvailableTimeCourseSymbols(void) to retrieve the list of all possible symbols.

parameterdescription.para: The string argument should be a space separated list of symbols.

simplesect.para: Returns true if successful

briefdescription.para: Get the selection list for the steady state analysis.

simplesect.para: Returns null if it fails, otherwise it returns a list of strings representing symbols in the selection list

briefdescription.para: Get the value for a given symbol, use getAvailableTimeCourseSymbols(void) for a list of symbols.

parameterdescription.para: The symbol that we wish to obtain the value for
The value that will be retrieved

simplesect.para: Returns true if successful

memberdef.argsstring: (RRHandle handle, const char *symbolId, const double value)
memberdef.name: setValue

briefdescription.para: Set the value for a given symbol, use getAvailableTimeCourseSymbols(void) for a list of symbols.

parameterdescription.para: The symbol that we wish to set the value
The value that will be set to the symbol

simplesect.para: Returns true if successful

briefdescription.para: Retrieve in a vector the concentrations for all the floating species.

simplesect.para: Returns the vector of floating species concentrations or null if an error occurred

briefdescription.para: Retrieve in a vector the amounts for all the floating species.

simplesect.para: Returns the vector of floating species amounts or null if an error occurred

briefdescription.para: Retrieve in a vector the concentrations of all the independent floating species.

simplesect.para: Returns the vector of independent floating species concentrations or null if an error occurred

briefdescription.para: Retrieve in a vector the concentrations of all the dependent floating species.

simplesect.para: Returns the vector of dependent floating species concentrations or null if an error occurred

briefdescription.para: Retrieve in a vector the amounts of all the independent floating species.

simplesect.para: Returns the vector of independent floating species amounts or null if an error occurred

briefdescription.para: Retrieve in a vector the amounts of all the dependent floating species.

simplesect.para: Returns the vector of dependent floating species amounts or null if an error occurred

briefdescription.para: Retrieve the concentrations for all the boundary species in a vector.

simplesect.para: Returns the vector of boundary species concentrations or null if an error occurred

briefdescription.para: Retrieve the amounts for all the boundary species in a vector.

simplesect.para: Returns the vector of boundary species amounts or null if an error occurred

briefdescription.para: Retrieve the values for all the global parameter values in a vector.

simplesect.para: Returns the vector of global parameter values or null if an error occurred

simplesect.para: Returns true if successful

The concentration of the species to set

The value returned by the method

The volume of the compartment to set

briefdescription.para: Set the floating species concentration to the vector vec.

simplesect.para: Returns true if successful

briefdescription.para: Set the boundary species concentration to the vector vec.

parameterdescription.para: A vector of boundary species concentrations

simplesect.para: Returns true if successful

briefdescription.para: Retrieve the full Jacobian for the current model.

simplesect.para: Returns null if it fails, otherwise returns the full Jacobian matrix

briefdescription.para: Retrieve the reduced Jacobian for the current model.

simplesect.para: Returns null if it fails, otherwise returns the reduced Jacobian matrix

briefdescription.para: Retrieve the eigenvalue matrix for the current model.

simplesect.para: Returns null if it fails, otherwise returns a matrix of eigenvalues. The first column will contain the real values and the second column the imaginary values

briefdescription.para: Retrieve the stoichiometry matrix for the current model.

simplesect.para: Returns null if it fails, otherwise returns the stoichiometry matrix.

briefdescription.para: Retrieve the Link matrix for the current model.

simplesect.para: Returns null if it fails, otherwise returns the Link matrix.

briefdescription.para: Retrieve the reduced stoichiometry matrix for the current model.

simplesect.para: Returns null if it fails, otherwise returns reduced stoichiometry matrix

briefdescription.para: Retrieve the conservation matrix for the current model.

detaileddescription.para: The conservation laws as describe by row where the columns indicate the species Id.

simplesect.para: Returns null if it fails, otherwise returns the conservation matrix.

briefdescription.para: Set the initial floating species concentrations.

parameterdescription.para: A vector of species concentrations: order given by getFloatingSpeciesIds(RRHandle handle)

simplesect.para: Returns true if successful

briefdescription.para: Get the initial floating species concentrations.

simplesect.para: Returns null if it fails otherwise returns a vector containing the initial conditions

briefdescription.para: Get the initial floating species Ids.

simplesect.para: Returns null if it fails otherwise returns a vector containing names of the floating species

briefdescription.para: Get the initial floating species Ids.

simplesect.para: Returns null if it fails otherwise returns a vector containing names of the floating species

briefdescription.para: Obtain the number of reactions in the loaded model.

simplesect.para: Returns -1 if it fails, if successful it return 0 or more, indicating the number of reactions

briefdescription.para: Retrieve a give reaction rate as indicated by the index parameter.

parameterdescription.para: - The index is used to specify which reaction rate to retrieve
- The reaction rate is returned in the rate argument

simplesect.para: Returns false if it fails

briefdescription.para: Retrieve a vector of reaction rates as determined by the current state of the model.

simplesect.para: Returns null if it fails, otherwise it returns a vector of reaction rates

briefdescription.para: Retrieve a vector of reaction rates given a vector of species concentrations.

parameterdescription.para: The vector of floating species concentrations

simplesect.para: Returns null if it fails otherwise it returns a vector of reaction rates

briefdescription.para: Retrieve the vector of rates of change as determined by the current state of the model.

simplesect.para: Returns null if it fails, otherwise returns a vector of rates of change values

briefdescription.para: Retrieve the string list of rates of change Ids.

simplesect.para: Returns null if it fails, otherwise returns a list of rates of change Ids

briefdescription.para: Retrieve the rate of change for a given floating species.

parameterdescription.para: Pointer to double, holding the rate of change

simplesect.para: Returns false if it fails, otherwise value contains the rate of change.

briefdescription.para: Retrieve the vector of rates of change given a vector of floating species concentrations.

parameterdescription.para: Vector handle holding rates of change

simplesect.para: Returns null if it fails

briefdescription.para: Evaluate the current model, that it update all assignments and rates of change. Do not carry out an integration step.

simplesect.para: Returns false if it fails

briefdescription.para: Returns the number of compartments in the model.

simplesect.para: Returns number of compartments

Returns the number of floating species in the model.
Returns the number of global parameters in the model.

Obtain the list of reaction Ids.

simplesect.para: Returns null if it fails, if successful it returns a pointer to a RRStringArrayPtr struct

The floating species to compute the elasticity for
The return value for the elasticity

memberdef.argsstring: (RRHandle handle, const char *variable, const char *parameter, double *value)
memberdef.name: getuCC

briefdescription.para: Retrieve a single unscaled control coefficient.

parameterdescription.para: This is the dependent variable of the coefficient, for example a flux or species concentration
This is the independent parameter, for example a kinetic constant or boundary species
This is the value of the unscaled control coefficient returns to the caller

simplesect.para: Returns true if successful

memberdef.argsstring: (RRHandle handle, const char *variable, const char *parameter, double *value)
memberdef.name: getCC

briefdescription.para: Retrieve a single control coefficient.

parameterdescription.para: This is the dependent variable of the coefficient, for example a flux or species concentration
This is the independent parameter, for example a kinetic constant or boundary species
This is the value of the control coefficient returns to the caller

simplesect.para: Returns true if successful

briefdescription.para: Retrieve the differential step size used in routines such as getCC.

parameterdescription.para: This is the value of the step size returns to the caller

simplesect.para: Returns true if successful

briefdescription.para: Sets the differential step size used in routines such as getCC.

parameterdescription.para: This is the desired step size value

simplesect.para: Returns true if successful

memberdef.argsstring: (RRHandle handle, const char *name, const char *species, double *value)
memberdef.name: getEE

briefdescription.para: Retrieve a single elasticity coefficient.

parameterdescription.para: This is the reaction variable for the elasticity
This is the independent parameter, for example a floating of boundary species
This is the value of the elasticity coefficient returns to the caller

simplesect.para: Returns true if successful

memberdef.argsstring: (RRHandle handle, const char *name, const char *species, double *value)
memberdef.name: getuEE

briefdescription.para: Retrieve a single unscaled elasticity coefficient.

parameterdescription.para: This is the reaction variable for the unscaled elasticity
This is the independent parameter, for example a floating of boundary species
This is the value of the unscaled elasticity coefficient returns to the caller

simplesect.para: Returns true if successful

briefdescription.para: Determine the current seed used by the random generator.

parameterdescription.para: This is the value of the current seed, returned to the caller

simplesect.para: Returns true if successful

briefdescription.para: Set the current seed used by the random generator.

parameterdescription.para: This is the value the caller will set the seed to

simplesect.para: Returns true if successful

briefdescription.para: Carry out a time-course simulation using the Gillespie algorithm with variable step size. setTimeStart, setTimeEnd, etc are used to set the simulation characteristics.

simplesect.para: Returns an array (RRCDataPtr) of columns containing the results of the simulation including string labels for the individual columns. The client is responsible for freeing the resulting RRCDataPtr structure.

briefdescription.para: Carry out a time-course simulation using the Gillespie algorithm based on the given arguments, time start, time end and number of points.

simplesect.para: Returns an array (RRCDataPtr) of columns containing the results of the simulation including string labels for the individual columns. The client is responsible for freeing the resulting RRCDataPtr structure.

briefdescription.para: Carry out a time-course simulation using the Gillespie algorithm with fixed step size. setTimeStart, setTimeEnd, setNumPoints, etc are used to set the simulation characteristics.

simplesect.para: Returns an array (RRCDataPtr) of columns containing the results of the simulation including string labels for the individual columns. The client is responsible for freeing the resulting RRCDataPtr structure.

memberdef.argsstring: (RRHandle handle, double timeStart, double timeEnd, int numberOfPoints)
memberdef.name: gillespieOnGridEx

briefdescription.para: Carry out a time-course simulation using the Gillespie algorithm with fixed step size based on the given arguments, time start, time end, and number of points.

parameterdescription.para: Fixed number of points to generate

simplesect.para: Returns an array (RRCDataPtr) of columns containing the results of the simulation including string labels for the individual columns. The client is responsible for freeing the resulting RRCDataPtr structure.

briefdescription.para: Carry out a series of time-course simulations using the Gillespie algorithm with fixed step size, then return the average of the simulations. setTimeStart, setTimeEnd, setNumPoints, etc are used to set the simulation characteristics.

simplesect.para: Returns an array (RRCDataPtr) of columns containing the average of the results of the simulations including string labels for the individual columns. The client is responsible for freeing the resulting RRCDataPtr structure.

memberdef.argsstring: (RRHandle handle, double timeStart, double timeEnd, int numberOfPoints, int numberOfSimulations)
memberdef.name: gillespieMeanOnGridEx

briefdescription.para: Carry out a series of time-course simulations using the Gillespie algorithm with fixed step size, then return the average of the simulations. Based on the given arguments, time start, time end, and number of points.

parameterdescription.para: Fixed number of points to generate

simplesect.para: Returns an array (RRCDataPtr) of columns containing the average of the results of the simulation including string labels for the individual columns. The client is responsible for freeing the resulting RRCDataPtr structure.

briefdescription.para: Carry out a series of time-course simulations using the Gillespie algorithm with fixed step size, then return the average and standard deviation of the simulations. setTimeStart, setTimeEnd, setNumPoints, etc are used to set the simulation characteristics.

simplesect.para: Returns an array (RRCDataPtr) of columns containing the average of the results of the simulations including string labels for the individual columns. The averages are in Data and the standard deviations are in Weights. The client is responsible for freeing the resulting RRCDataPtr structure.

memberdef.argsstring: (RRHandle handle, double timeStart, double timeEnd, int numberOfSteps, int numberOfSimulations)
memberdef.name: gillespieMeanSDOnGridEx

briefdescription.para: Carry out a series of time-course simulations using the Gillespie algorithm with fixed step size, then return the average and standard deviation of the simulations. Based on the given arguments, time start, time end, number of points, and number of simulations.

parameterdescription.para: Fixed number of steps to generate

simplesect.para: Returns an array (RRCDataPtr) of columns containing the average of the results of the simulation including string labels for the individual columns. The average values are in Data and the standard deviations are in Weights. The client is responsible for freeing the resulting RRCDataPtr structure.

Set the selection list for output from simulate(void) or simulateEx(void) Use setTimeCourseSelectionListEx(handle, length, list) to set the the simulate selection list. Compared to setTimeCourseSelectionList, setTimeCourseSelectionListEx, expects a list of char* strings otherwise it has identical functionality.

parameterdescription.para: Number of elements in the list
A list of char* strings of Ids

simplesect.para: Returns true if successful

Compared to setSteadyStateSelectionList, setSteadyStateSelectionList, expects a list of char* strings otherwise it has identical functionality. Example:
